detaileddescription.para: A recursive helper function for tripal_galaxy_get_workflow_defaults.

parameterdescription.para: The 'tool_inputs' array for the step, or the sub elements on a recursive call.
A pass-by-reference of the $parameters array.
The 'input_steps' array for the step. This is always passed as is at every recursion level.
The key used to lookup up if an element has a key in the $step_inputs. For nested keys they are concatenated. with a '|' separating each level.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a new Galaxy server to Tripal.

parameterdescription.para:
An associative array containing the following key/value pairs:
servername: A human-readable name for the Galaxy server. The servername must be unique and not already present.
description: (optional) a description about this server.
url: The full URL for the server (e.g. https://usegalaxy.org/)
username: The name of the user to connect as.
api_key: The API key of the user. This allows Tripal to access the Galaxy server's RESTful API services.
uid: The Drupal User ID who created this record.

simplesect.para: object The newly created Galaxy object or FALSE on error. If the record already exists the object is returned and no duplicated record is added.

detaileddescription.para: Adds a remote Galaxy Workflow to Tripal.

parameterdescription.para: An ID of the galaxy server.

An associative array used to specify the workflow. The workflow can be identified using the Galaxy workflow ID provided using the 'workflow_id' key or using the workflow name provided using the 'workflow_name' key.
If TRUE, creates a webform for the end-user to submit this workflow using the Tripal website. It will automatically create a history for this workflow on the remote Galaxy server as well.

simplesect.para: object A workflow object or FALSE on error. If the workflow has already been added, then the workflow object is returned and no duplicate record is added.

detaileddescription.para: Checks and updates the status of a Galaxy workflow.

parameterdescription.para: The submission ID of the workflow.
If a workflow submission is already completed this function will quickly return and not check the status again. Setting the $force argument to TRUE will force the function to check the status.

simplesect.para: bool Returns TRUE on successful checking of the status, FALSE if a problem occured.

detaileddescription.para: Deletes expired histories.
Walks through the tripal_galaxy_workflow_submission table and deletes any workflows older than specified in the tripal_galaxy_history_age system variable.
Deletes a single remote history from the remote galaxy server.

parameterdescription.para: A unique ID for the galaxy server. If this is provided no other arguments are needed.
The name of the history to retrieve. If the history doesn't exist then it will be created.

simplesect.para: bool TRUE if the deletion was successful, FALSE otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a list of all workflow submissions that have not completed.

simplesect.para: array An array of submission objects.

detaileddescription.para: Retreives a GalaxyInstance objects using a galaxy_id

parameterdescription.para: The ID of a galaxy server.

simplesect.para: GalaxyInstance A galaxyInstance object or FALSE on error.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the URI where the Tripal Galaxy module stores files.
This function also ensures that the path exists by creating it.

simplesect.para: string|bool A Drupal URI indicating the location where Galaxy files are housed. Returns FALSE if the location does not exist or cannot be created.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a list of Galaxy servers that are known to Tripal.

simplesect.para: array An associative array of galaxy server objects. Note, the returned objects are different from the GalaxyInstance objects provided by blend4php. These objects house the information that Tripal maintains about each of these servers.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a Galaxy object.

parameterdescription.para: The ID of the galaxy server to retrieve. A list of all galxy servers known to Tripal can be retrieved using the tripal_galaxy_get_galaxies() function.

simplesect.para: object A galaxy object Note, the returned object is different from the GalaxyInstance object provided by blend4php. This objects house the information that Tripal maintains about each the servers.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a history by name from Galaxy.
If the history does not exist then one is created.

parameterdescription.para: A GalaxyInstance object
The name of the history to retrieve. If the history doesn't exist then it will be created.
An empty array into which the error type and message will be placed if an error occurs.

simplesect.para: array|bool A history array for the specified history. If a failure occured then FALSE is returned and the $error argument is set.

detaileddescription.para: Constructs the history name for a given submission.

parameterdescription.para: A submission object that contains the galaxy_workflow_id, sid, and submit_date properties.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a workflow submission object using the submission ID.

parameterdescription.para: The submission ID of the workflow.

simplesect.para: object An object containing the submisssion information.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves an array of settings used by the workflow.
This is a helpful function to help a developer understand how the $parameters array should be structured when passing into the tripal_galaxy_invoke_workflow() function.

parameterdescription.para: A GalaxyInstance object.
The ID of the workflow to retrieve settings for. This is the Galaxy ID for the workflow.

simplesect.para: An array compatible with the $parameters argument for the tripal_galaxy_invoke_wokflow(). Values are populatd with appropriate defaults. Returns FALSE if the workflow settings could not be retrieved.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a list of workflows matching the given criteria.

parameterdescription.para:
An associative array used to find workflows. The following keys are supported:
galaxy_id: finds all workflows that match the given galayx_id.
id: finds the workflow with this specific workflow ID.
workflow_id: the ID of the workflow on the remote Galaxy instance.
name: finds the workflow with a given name. Note: the workflow name is not guranteed to be unique.
status: finds all workflows whose status matches the value provided. Any combination of the keys can be used.

simplesect.para: array An array of workflow objects.

detaileddescription.para: Initializes a new workflow submission record.
This function creates the record for the submission.

parameterdescription.para: An workflow object as generated by the tripal_galaxy_get_workflow() function.
The Drupal User object. This is the user who owns the submission.

simplesect.para: int|bool The submission ID on success, FALSE on failure.

detaileddescription.para: Invokes all submitted workflows that are in the 'Waiting' state.
This function can be called by the tripal Job system hence the $job argument. For Tripal v2 the job_id is passed, for Tripal v3 a job object is passed so we'll handle both cases.

parameterdescription.para: An instance of a GalaxyInstance object.
A Galaxy workflow submission object. This object can be retrieved using the tripal_galaxy_get_submission() function.
A history record as returned by the function tripal_galaxy_get_history().

detaileddescription.para: Splits a URL to a Galaxy server into the host, port and if HTTPS is required.

parameterdescription.para: The URL for the remote galaxy instance.

simplesect.para: array An array with three keys: host, port and use_https.

detaileddescription.para: Tests if a Galaxy server is accessible.

parameterdescription.para:
An array of the following:
galaxy_id: A unique ID for the galaxy server. If this is provided no other arguments are needed.
host: The DNS hostname of the galaxy server.
port: The TCP port for the server.
use_https: Set to TRUE of the server uses HTTPS

simplesect.para: bool Returns TRUE if accessible. FALSE otherwise. A Drupal message is also provided that indicates if the test was successful.

detaileddescription.para: Uploads a file to a given history on Galaxy.

parameterdescription.para: An instance of a Galaxy server object.
The Drupal managed file ID.
The history ID.
The Galaxy history contents array as returned by the GalaxyHistoryContents::index function.

simplesect.para: array An array of the dataset details from Galaxy for the uploaded file.

detaileddescription.para: Provides an application programming interface (API) for the Tripal Galaxy module.
